abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Community Development Fund
            Project will improve the quality of community
            infrastructure, and services in poor, and conflict-affected
            communities, and/or vulnerable groups, and, promote
            institutional capacity-building, and social capital
            formation. In view of the nature of this project, namely the
            infrastructure development aspects of its micro-projects for
            health and education facilities, water supply, wastewater
            sewage and small scale irrigation, and roads construction,
            this environmental assessment stipulates the following
            mitigation measures. To minimize soil erosion and
            contamination due to construction, and/or medical waste
            materials, regular control and cleaning of construction
            sites should be enforced, including the provision of
            adequate waste disposal services. Special attention should
            be given to drainage systems, with a proper disposal of oil
            and other hazardous materials, adequately disposed of,
            according to sanitary, and standard waste disposal
            regulations. Construction should be restricted to daytime
            hours, to prevent noise disturbances, and in addition, prior
            to construction, special attention should be given to site
            selection, to mitigate loss of natural vegetation (to be
            followed by re-vegetation practices), or sensitive species.
            Protection of historical/cultural sites, call for the
            immediate notification to the relevant authorities should
            archaeological finds occur. Specifically designed methods
            should be in place for the disposal of medical wastes.
            Regarding irrigation schemes, extension and training in crop
            selection, and agricultural technology should be provided,
            to include as well adequate drainage systems, and control of
            agrochemical uses.
